intro: Cuphea santos-limae, commonly known as the Santos-Limae cuphea, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Peru. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
